conclusion: Determine the amount of charge passing through R1 after switch S is opened.
Determine steady-state voltages across capacitors when switch S is closed.
When switch S is closed, capacitors are fully charged and act as open circuits.
Total resistance in the circuit is 10.0 Ω.
Voltage across C1 (and R1) is 4 V.
Voltage across C2 (and R2) is 6 V.
Calculate charges stored on the capacitors.
Determine new voltages and charges when switch S is opened.
Total charge before opening switch is 300 μC.
Equivalent capacitance in series is 15 μF.
Voltage across series combination is 20 V.
Voltage across each capacitor is 10 V.
Calculate new charges on the capacitors.
New charge on C1 is 300 μC.
